coref: A Heron was walking sedately along the bank of a stream, A Heron eyes on the clear water, and A Heron long neck and pointed bill ready to snap up a likely morsel for A Heron breakfast. the clear water swarmed with fish, but A Heron A Heron was hard to please that morning. No small fry for me, No small fry for me said. Such scanty fare is not fit for A HeronA Heron. Now a fine young Perch swam near. No indeed, said A Heron. I wouldn't even trouble to open my beak for anything like that! As the sun rose, the fish left the shallow water near the shore and swam below into the cool depths toward the middle. A Heron A Heron saw no more fish, and very glad was A Heron at last to breakfast on a tiny Snail.
